step.name: file-move
step.short-description: Moves or renames a file or directory

description.para: A c:result element containing the absolute URI of the target (the c prefix here is bound to the http://www.w3.org/ns/xproc-step namespace).
The URI of the source file or directory to move (or rename).
The URI of the target file or directory to move to.
Determines what happens if an error occurs during the move operation:

listitem.para: If this option is true (default), an appropriate XProc error is raised.
If this option is false, the step returns a c:error document (see here for more information) on its result port.

summary.para: The step moves (or renames) a file or directory to a different location (or name).

description.para: The step attempts to move (or rename) the file or directory specified in the href option to the location specified in the target option. The result port emits a small XML document with only a c:result element containing the absolute URI of the target (the c prefix here is bound to the http://www.w3.org/ns/xproc-step namespace).
The inspiration for this step comes from the Unix mv command. If you’re not used to it, it may come as a surprise that moving something can also mean renaming it:

listitem.para: Moving file:///a/b/c.xml to file:///a/b2/c.xml moves the file to the b2 directory. See also the example.
But moving file:///a/b/c.xml to file:///a/b/c2.xml renames the file. See also the example.
An example of renaming a directory can be found in the example .

description.para: If you’re moving into another directory, this directory must exist. A target must not exist.

detail.para: Relative values for the href and target options are resolved against the base URI of the element on which this option is specified. In most cases this will be the static base URI of your pipeline (the path where the XProc source containing the is stored).
